column4: what's up #ubuntu. i was wondering if anyone could help me make a quick script.
basically, i want a script to add to my crontab which will tar up a directory, name the tar file based on the current date, and scp that file to an ssh server
you can't be serious. i can't get generic linux support for my ubuntu box in #ubuntu?
btw, people giving support in here do this _voluntarily_. You are _not_ to _expect_ anything from them.
because you appear (I could be wrong) to be showing a demanding attitude. I make the same mistake from time to time...
you want the file name to be the current date?
I always get confused about how to specify the format for the `date` command. `man date` should have an explanation for it.
scp file.name peter@somewhere.tld BUT only if keyless auth is set up
which means, you will have to enter, on your host, the contents of your local ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub into ~/.ssh/authorized_keys2
where, like compudaze stated, the id_rsa.pub file is created by issuing `ssh-keygen -t rsa`
just what it says. When you unpack the file, it will be relative to your working directory.
